abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio's administration strikes deal with city's eight largest park conservancies to donate expertise and work hours, representing about $15 million, to renovating parks in city's poorest neighborhoods; deal, part of mayor's Community Parks Initiative, runs through 2018, at which point parks officials hope it will be renewed.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio has struck a deal with eight of the largest park conservancies to donate expertise, staff hours and money to parks in poor neighborhoods.

headline.main: New York City’s Low-Profile Parks to Get Conservancies’ Help, and Some Cash
headline.print_headline: Poor or Ignored Parks to Get Help From Conservancies, and Some Cash

snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio has struck a deal with eight of the largest park conservancies to donate expertise, staff hours and money to parks in poor neighborhoods.
